sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
A true copy of a letter, from the justices of the Kingdom of Ireland, to the Privy Council of Scotland. Cuningsbey, Thomas, fl. 1691. Porter, Charles, Sir, d. 1696.
8 p.
by the heir of Andrew Anderson, printer to their most excellent Majesties, Printed at Dublin ; and re-printed at Edinburgh : Anno Dom. 1691.
Caption title. Letter dated: Dublin-Castle, 25th of July 1691. Signed: Your lordships most humble servants, Charles Porter. Tho: Cuningsbey. Imprint from colophon. Reproduction of the original in the National Library of Scotland. With: A particular and full account of the routing the whole Irish army at Aghrim upon Sunday the 12th of July 1691. With a list of the principal persons that were killed and taken prisoner.
=======

by the heir of Andrew Anderson, printer to their most excellent Majesties, Printed at Dublin ; and re-printed at Edinburgh : Anno Dom. 1691.
Caption title. Letter dated: Dublin-Castle, 25th of July 1691. Signed: Your lordships most humble servants, Charles Porter. Tho: Cuningsbey. Imprint from colophon. Reproduction of the original in the National Library of Scotland. With: A particular and full account of the routing the whole Irish army at Aghrim upon Sunday the 12th of July 1691. With a list of the principal persons that were killed and taken prisoner.
